title: Sam Sloan
added: In mid-1978, Sloan travelled to Afghanistan where he was arrested and charged with being a spy. He escaped from jail and fled to the U.S. embassy in Kabul and then left the country. He travelled to Pakistan where he met and married his second wife.<ref name="Ackman"/>

title: Sam Sloan
added: Sloan speaks English, Khowar, Spanish, German and Russian.

title: Sam Sloan
added: In 1979 Sloan changed his name to Mohammad Ismail Sloan.<ref name="Gadfly"/>

title: Sam Sloan
deleted: Sloan is a litigious American citizen. He often does his own legal work ''pro se''. Among his many cases that petitioned or reached the federal level are:

* Sloan v. [[Richard Nixon|Nixon]], 60 FRD 228 (1973).<ref>{{cite web |url=https://casetext.com/case/samuel-h-sloan-plaintiff-v-richard-m-nixon-et-al-defendants|title=Sloan vs. Nixon, 60 FRD 228 (1973) |publisher=casetext.com |accessdate=November 23, 2020 }}</ref><ref>[https://cite.case.law/frd/60/228/ Sloan v. Nixon] 1973, cite.case.law</ref> Complaint dismissed.
* [[U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission|SEC]] v. Sloan, 436 US 103 (1978) <ref name="SEC"/><ref name="SEC2"/> Won 9-0.

* Sloan v. [[Virginia]], No. 95-8909 (1995)<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.law.cornell.edu/supct/html/100796.ZOR.html |title=Sloan vs. Virginia, No. 95-8909 |publisher=law.cornell.edu |accessdate=November 23, 2020}}</ref> Petition for writ of certiorari to the Supreme Court of Virginia denied.

title: Sam Sloan
deleted: As of February 2020, Sloan's FIDE chess ratings were 1772 and 1880 for blitz.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://ratings.fide.com/card.phtml?event=2030390 |title=Sloan, Sam FIDE Chess Profile - Players Arbiters Trainers< |accessdate=February 4, 2020 }}</ref>

title: Sam Sloan
added: Sloan advised [[Don Dailey]] in Daileys efforts to develope the chess program 'Rex'.<ref>[https://www.chessprogramming.org/Sam_Sloan Sam Sloan] chessprogramming.org</ref>

title: Sam Sloan
added: Sloan is a litigious American citizen. He often does his own legal work ''pro se''. Among his many cases besides ''SEC v. Sloan'' that petitioned or reached the federal level are:
* Sloan v. [[Richard Nixon|Nixon]], 60 FRD 228 (1973).<ref name="Hallman"/> Complaint dismissed.

* Sloan v. [[Virginia]], No. 95-8909 (1995)<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.law.cornell.edu/supct/html/100796.ZOR.html |title=Sloan vs. Virginia, No. 95-8909 |publisher=law.cornell.edu |accessdate=November 23, 2020}}</ref> About Shamema custody struggle. Petition for writ of certiorari to the Supreme Court of Virginia denied.

title: Sam Sloan
deleted: Sloan is a litigious American citizen. He often does his own legal work ''pro se''. Among his many cases besides ''SEC v. Sloan'' that petitioned or reached the federal level are:
* Sloan v. [[Richard Nixon|Nixon]], 60 FRD 228 (1973).<ref name="Hallman"/> Complaint dismissed.

title: Sam Sloan
added: Sloan is an [[autodidact]] and with very little training he filed ''pro se'' a suit against [[Richard Nixon]] et al that reached the federal level known as ''Sloan v. Nixon'' in 1973.<ref name="Hallman"/>

title: Sam Sloan
deleted: Since 2010 Sloan has been a [[perennial candidate]]; running for some elected office each year but rarely winning.
